import { Meta } from '@storybook/addon-docs';

<Meta title="Docs/Theme/Blocks" />

# Theme Blocks
A set of components to use in Storybook to display theme. It provides
the following block components:

- Typography Block
- Color Block
- Spacing Block
- Border Block
- Shadow Block
- Palette Block
- Icons Block ( icons not included )

## Example
Here is an example Storybook story that uses the theme Blocks.

```tsx
import React from 'react';
import {
  TypographyBlocks,
  ColorBlocks,
  SpacingBlocks,
  PaletteBlocks,
  BorderBlocks,
  ShadowBlocks,
  ThemeProvider,
  darkTheme,
  IconBlocks
} from 'reablocks';

import resolveConfig from 'tailwindcss/resolveConfig';
import tailwindConfig from '../path_to_tw_config/tailwind.config';
const { theme: TWConfig } = resolveConfig(tailwindConfig);

export default {
  title: 'General/Theme',
  component: ThemeProvider,
  decorators: [
    Story => (
      <ThemeProvider theme={darkTheme}>
        <div style={{ width: '90vw' }}>
          <Story />
        </div>
      </ThemeProvider>
    )
  ]
};


const colors = TWConfig.colors;
export const Colors = () => (
  <ColorBlocks colors={colors} />
);

export const Palettes = () => (
  <PaletteBlocks palettes={colors} />
);

const families = TWConfig.fontFamily;
const sizes = TWConfig.fontSize;
const weights = TWConfig.fontWeight;
export const Typography = () => (
  <TypographyBlocks families={families} sizes={sizes} weights={weights} />
);

const spacings = TWConfig.spacing;
export const Spacings = () => (
  <SpacingBlocks spacings={spacings} />
);

const borders = TWConfig.borderRadius;
export const Borders = () => (
  <BorderBlocks borders={borders} />
);

const shadows = TWConfig.boxShadow;
export const Shadows = () => (
  <ShadowBlocks shadows={shadows} />
);


const icons = [
  {
    name: 'favorite',
    src: favoriteIconSrc
  },
   {
    name: 'favorite',
    component: FavoriteIconComponent
  }
];

export const Icons = () => (
  <IconBlocks icons={icons} />
);
````

NOTE: This example uses the `ThemeProvider` in the story decorator,
but you can also use it in the `preview.js` file to wrap all stories.
